title: The Americas with Simon Reeve, episode 1 review - cold comfort in a journey across the snowy north
text:
I’ve never been able to get on-board with adventurer Simon Reeve, who the BBC seem grimly determined to turn into a star, despite all evidence to the contrary. He even appeared on Graham Norton’s couch last week, perched awkwardly between Dame Helen Mirren and RuPaul. Quite the queenly sandwich.

Reeve’s face, almost as forgettable as his beige name, fades from my memory the moment the credits roll. His mop-top hair and earnest enthusiasm, cut from similar cloth to Professor Brian Cox, remind me of a “gap yah” student - an impression hardly helped by him spending half this episode lecturing us about climate change. Such finger-wagging seems to be compulsory in BBC documentaries nowadays.
